name: Lamb's Ear
climate: Lamb's Ear prefers temperate climates where extremes are not common.
Thrives well in regions with cool summers and mild winters.
Not well-suited for tropical climates with high humidity levels.
Can withstand some frost, but extreme cold may damage the plant.
sunlight: Requires full sun to partial shade to thrive effectively.
In regions with intense heat, some afternoon shade is beneficial.
Lack of sunlight may result in leggy growth and reduced vigor.
Avoid planting in deep shade as it can impede plant health.
watering: Prefers well-drained soil to avoid root rot from excess moisture.
Water moderately, allowing the topsoil to dry between watering.
Overwatering can lead to fungal diseases and plant decline.
Drought-tolerant once established, requiring less frequent water.
soil: Grows best in well-draining soil with good air circulation.
Soil should be on the sandy side, avoiding heavy, clay soils.
A slight acidic to neutral pH (6.0 to 7.0) is preferred for growth.
Amending soil with organic matter can improve drainage and fertility.
extra_care_tip: Prune flower spikes after blooming to encourage compact growth.
Remove dead leaves to prevent mold and maintain plant health.
